item.title: What's a Lambda? A Brief Walk from Lisp → Closures → Java
item.description: Note: This began as an explainer for seasoned engineers learning Java 8. It’s not exhaustive, but it is designed to make lambdas intuitive—and maybe even fun. TLDR; A lambda is an anonymous function—a piece of executable code you can create inline, pass around, and call later. Lisp created them decades ago. Java added them in 2014 (Java 8), built on top of functional interfaces. Let’s see how they work in Lisp first, then translate that understanding into Java.
